questions.question_text: Which of the following provides the BEST assurance of data integrity after file transfers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Comparing the hash value before and after the transfer allows for the detection of any alterations or corruption in the data.

choices.B: To ensure project deliverables were provided on time
choices.D: To calculate a project's actual cost against the projected cost
choices.C: To determine whether expected benefits were realized from a project
choices.A: To ensure project resources were optimized

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY purpose of a post-implementation review?

discussion.content: C. To determine whether expected benefits were realized from a project

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important to consider when reviewing an organization's defined data backup and restoration procedures?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The Recovery Point Objective (RPO) is a critical aspect of backup procedures, representing the maximum allowable data loss in the event of a disruption. It defines the point in time to which data must be restored to resume normal operations. Understanding the RPO helps ensure that the organization's backup and restoration procedures align with business requirements for data recovery.

questions.question_text: When assessing a proposed project for the two-way replication of a customer database with a remote call center, the IS auditor should ensure that:

choices.B: the source database is backed up on both sites.
choices.A: end users are trained in the replication process.
choices.C: user rights are identical on both databases.
choices.D: database conflicts are managed during replication.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Two-way replication involves synchronizing data between two databases in both directions. Database conflicts can occur when changes are made to the same data in both databases simultaneously, and managing these conflicts is crucial to ensure data consistency and integrity.

Selected Answer: C
Throughout the audit, audit clients will be informed of the audit process through regular status meetings and/or communications. The audit team makes every effort to discuss audit observations, potential issues, and proposed recommendations as they are identified. In some instances, it is necessary to work directly with audit clients to determine or validate the root cause and discuss ways to eliminate the root cause.

Selected answer: C
According to CSUSM.EDU - “The evaluation phase of the audit is referred to as fieldwork. To assess the adequacy of internal controls and compliance, the auditor interviews key personnel, reviews departmental records and processes, and tests a sample of transactions in detail.

Throughout fieldwork, the auditor discusses initial audit observations and outstanding document requests with the auditee during status meetings. It also allows the auditee to clarify or provide additional documentation to resolve any concerns or clear any preliminary observations.”

Selected Answer: D
The audit life cycle typically consists of several phases, including planning, execution, reporting, and follow-up. In the reporting phase, the auditor communicates the findings and observations to the client. This involves preparing the audit report, which includes details about the audit scope, objectives, methodologies, and, most importantly, the audit observations and recommendations. During this phase, the auditor discusses the observations with the client, seeking clarification or additional information if necessary. The reporting phase is crucial for ensuring transparency, accountability, and understanding between the auditor and the client regarding the audit results.

questions.question_text: In which phase of the audit life cycle process are audit observations initially discussed with the client?
